014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
017import java.lang.reflect.Type;
018import java.sql.ResultSet;
019import java.sql.ResultSetMetaData;
020import java.sql.SQLException;
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.HashMap;
023import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Optional;
027import java.util.Set;
028import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
029
030import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
031import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
032import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes;
033import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultBearing;
034import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
035import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
036
037/**
038 * Factory for a RowMapper that can map resultset rows to column name/generic value {@link Map}s.
039 *
040 * Each row in the resultset becomes a distinct {@link Map}, in which the keys are all distinct column names and the values are the corresponding cell contents.
041 * All values are mapped to the same generic type {@code T} (e.g. {@link java.math.BigDecimal}) by a {@link ColumnMapper} from the {@link ConfigRegistry}.
042 *
043 * This differs from {@link MapMapper} by supporting a concrete type instead of only {@link Object}, and from {@code collecting} into a {@link Map}
044 * in that the latter maps an entire resultset to a single {@link Map} and can only keep 1 key and 1 value from each row.
045 *
046 * Use cases for this are mainly single-row results like numeric reports (e.g. the price components,
047 * taxes, etc of a product for sale, or a set of possible labeled values for a user setting), and matrices.
048 *
049 * @see ResultBearing#mapToMap(GenericType)
050 *
051 * @see MapMapper
052 * @see ResultBearing#mapToMap()
053 *
054 * @see ResultBearing#collectInto(GenericType)
055 */
056@Beta
057// TODO jdbi4: integrate with MapMapper? check if registering by default is compatible with other Map-mapping features
058public class GenericMapMapperFactory implements RowMapperFactory {
059    // invoked by sqlobject
060    @Override
061    public Optional<RowMapper<?>> build(Type mapType, ConfigRegistry config) {
062        return Optional.of(mapType)
063            .filter(ParameterizedType.class::isInstance)
064            .map(ParameterizedType.class::cast)
065            .filter(maybeMap -> Map.class.equals(maybeMap.getRawType()))
066            .filter(map -> String.class.equals(GenericTypes.findGenericParameter(map, Map.class, 0).orElse(null)))
067            .flatMap(map -> GenericTypes.findGenericParameter(map, Map.class, 1))
068            .filter(value -> !Object.class.equals(value))
069            .flatMap(config.get(ColumnMappers.class)::findFor)
070            .map(GenericMapMapper::new);
071    }
072
073    // invoked manually or by fluent api
074    @Beta
075    public static <T> RowMapper<Map<String, T>> getMapperForValueType(Class<T> valueType, ConfigRegistry config) {
076        return config.get(ColumnMappers.class)
077            .findFor(valueType)
078            .map(GenericMapMapper::new)
079            .orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("no column mapper found for type " + valueType));
080    }
081
082    // invoked manually or by fluent api
083    @Beta
084    public static <T> RowMapper<Map<String, T>> getMapperForValueType(GenericType<T> valueType, ConfigRegistry config) {
085        return config.get(ColumnMappers.class)
086            .findFor(valueType)
087            .map(GenericMapMapper::new)
088            .orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("no column mapper found for type " + valueType));
089    }
090
091    private static class GenericMapMapper<T> implements RowMapper<Map<String, T>> {
092        private final ColumnMapper<T> mapper;
093
094        private GenericMapMapper(ColumnMapper<T> mapper) {
095            this.mapper = mapper;
096        }
097
098        @Override
099        public Map<String, T> map(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
100            return specialize(rs, ctx).map(rs, ctx);
101        }
102
103        @Override
104        public RowMapper<Map<String, T>> specialize(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
105            List<String> keyNames = getMapKeys(rs.getMetaData(), ctx.getConfig(MapMappers.class).getCaseChange());
106
107            return (r, c) -> {
108                Map<String, T> row = new HashMap<>();
109
110                for (int i = 0; i < keyNames.size(); i++) {
111                    T value = mapper.map(r, i + 1, ctx);
112                    row.put(keyNames.get(i), value);
113                }
114
115                return row;
116            };
117        }
118
119        private static List<String> getMapKeys(ResultSetMetaData meta, UnaryOperator<String> caseChange) throws SQLException {
120            // important: ordered, not sorted, and unique
121            Set<String> names = new LinkedHashSet<>();
122            int columnCount = meta.getColumnCount();
123
124            for (int i = 0; i < columnCount; i++) {
125                String columnName = meta.getColumnName(i + 1);
126                String columnLabel = meta.getColumnLabel(i + 1);
127
128                String key = columnLabel == null ? columnName : columnLabel;
129                String renamedKey = caseChange.apply(key);
130
131                boolean added = names.add(renamedKey);
132                if (!added) {
133                    throw new RuntimeException(String.format("map key \"%s\" (from column \"%s\") appears twice in this resultset!", renamedKey, key));
134                }
135            }
136
137            return new ArrayList<>(names);
138        }
139    }
140}
